title: How does Sony’s speakerless OLED TV work? - Quora

response.answer_text: It isn’t speakerless. It has a traditional speaker on the back that acts as a subwoofer. The screen itself is an electrostatic speaker that boasts such precision that the sound comes from the place on the screen where the sound originated (ie the subjects mouth on the screen is where the sound comes from in that moment). It’s part of the reason they can command around 1k more than other oled brands out there on the market. Peace and Love.
